title: [Maurie Fields and Val Jellay Home Movies: Reel 11]
brief_description:
This film is a snapshot of a family holiday in Thailand.

The film has the occasional hair in the gate and some rough hand-held techniques.

The film opens with street scenes somewhere in Thailand. We see bicycle tuk tuks, smiling children and a policeman.

A road trip includes a stop over to make an offering at a street side Buddhist shrine. We see local buses and vehicles including a Volkswagen Kombi van.

The film shows a boat trip along a congested river, which could be in the area of the historic city of Ayutthaya. We see bridges, speed boats, welcome signs, vendors selling postcards and a welcome sign reading “Dummearn Souvernir”. A jolly Maurie Fields smiles as water from the river splashes past his face.

There is a visit to a temple which could possibly be Wat Phra Si Sanphet on the site of the old Royal Palace in Thailand’s ancient capital of Ayutthaya.

Originally shot on Super 8mm film

Selecteed highlights list:
00:00:02:00 Bicycle tuk tuks, children, policeman

00:01:54:00 Profile of Maurie Fields on the river
